channel.title: Can't get a .Jar to work
channel.description:
[img]http://s20.postimage.org/exo4zgsf1/capture_10.png[/img]
Any ideas on what's wrong here? I tried following a guide on how to make a jar file but it just won't work. Any help would be much appreciated.

item.title: Can't get a .Jar to work
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“smooth jazz, post:8, topic:477862”]Yes it should have been client, I got confused because it was still giving me an error running it from a batch file but opening the jar works.

The guide I used said to make it EGUI, and I’m new at this, sorry for looking like an idiot.[/quote]
Np has to start somewhere

Read full topic

item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:5, topic:477862”]Shouldn’t the main class be client.class? Try that and tell me y/n[/quote]
Nope it must be Client.
I always did that and it always works for me

item.title: Can't get a .Jar to work
item.dc:creator: @smooth_jazz smooth jazz
item.description:
@smooth_jazz wrote:

[quote=“luna-scape, post:2, topic:477862”][quote author=smooth jazz link=topic=596058.msg4196716#msg4196716 date=1357597794]

Any ideas on what’s wrong here? I tried following a guide on how to make a jar file but it just won’t work. Any help would be much appreciated.
[/quote]

For jarring:

Import directory= file in client where ur class files are
Change the name To: client.jar
For output directory= file in client where ur class files are located (same as input)
Set manifest name to client and create the jar :)[/quote]

Thanks for replying, but my problem is it won’t recognize the main class (EGUI) when I put it in the manifest, and why I tried to change it to “client” instead it has the same problem.

What exactly should I put as the command to compile the jar? Right now it’s

@echo off
title JAR Compiler
color 1E
jar cvfm client.jar manifest.java .
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Can't get a .Jar to work
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“smooth jazz, post:1, topic:477862”]

Any ideas on what’s wrong here? I tried following a guide on how to make a jar file but it just won’t work. Any help would be much appreciated.[/quote]

For jarring:

Import directory= file in client where ur class files are
Change the name To: client.jar
For output directory= file in client where ur class files are located (same as input)
Set manifest name to client and create the jar
